channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12529] HiveTxnManager.acquireLocks() should not block forever
item.description:
Currently, in DbTxnManager this method will block until all competing locks have gone away.
This is not appropriate for all clients. There should be a way to specify a max-wait-time.
It will throw an exception on timeout (given how current method signature is written).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12775077 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

I don't understand what you're trying to do here. It looks like you want to unlock the waiting locks without rolling back the transaction. Is that true? If so, why? Allowing this violates a lot of assumptions in the code and I'm afraid we'll cause a lot of bugs. Why not roll back the transaction at that point?
This is client code. The transaction that added 'w' locks closed already since it returned a WAITING status to clietnt
patch 5 only adds a few comments to patch 4. no code changes
Ok, makes sense with the comments added. Thanks. +1

ATTACHMENT ID: 12775438 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Will this be committed to branch-2.0 for release 2.0.0 (as well as branch-1 for 1.3.0 and master for 2.1.0)?

Doc note: This adds configuration parameter hive.txn.manager.dump.lock.state.on.acquire.timeout and changes the description of hive.lock.sleep.between.retries so they need to be documented in the wiki.

  • Configuration Properties – Transactions and Compactor
  • Configuration Properties – Locking – hive.lock.sleep.between.retries
